intro: Arachne chinensis, commonly known as the Chinese nettle, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It belongs to the Urticaceae family and is characterized by its stinging hairs on the leaves and stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with opposite, ovate leaves that have serrated edges. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests and along stream banks. The flowers are small and greenish-white, arranged in clusters, and the plant is used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
